Description: Egyptian terracotta model sword. A mould-made model sword lacking its scabbard, with a ribbed handle with triple or quadruple balled pommel, the guard of pedimental form enclosing a raided stud. The blade has been pared. The back is plain except for a jog where the hilt meets the blade. There is some possibility that this is a sheathed sword, but it seems more likely that it is a sword alone. Solid, from two-piece mould. Traces of a white dressing, thicker on the handle than the blade; a splodge of white plaster covers the break at the tip of the blade. Orange-brown Nile silt with a red-brown surface and abundant fine gold mica and white inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Town (Naukratis), Site 95 (Petrie), the terracotta workshop, at the eastern edge of the town
Curator's comments: Fabric very similar to examples from the terracottas workshop in Naukratis. See other examples from Naukratis also at the British museum (BM 1888,0601.116, BM 1886,0401.1539 ,BM 1886,0401.153). Parallel found in the Fayum, now in Cairo Museum (TR6/3/36/1=SR5/1134).
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (C632)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DF.01) (Phase 1)
